cinnamon.engine.system

Interface ControlMap

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultControlMap

    public interface ControlMap

    A hub for input Events to be distributed when the appropriate hardware is triggered (an early control mapping system).

    KeyEvents and MouseEvents to react to should be added through addEvent(KeyEvent) or addEvent(MouseEvent) while actions to execute are linked to hardware constants through the attach (hardware, handler) methods. Calling fire() will execute the attached EventHandlers when their firing conditions have been met.

    Each hardware constant has a desired firing condition which must be met before its attached KeyEventHandler or MouseEventHandler can be triggered. The desired condition can be set through setMode(KeyEvent.Key, boolean, boolean) and setMode(MouseEvent.Button, boolean, boolean) to specify firing on a InputEvent.Action.PRESS, InputEvent.Action.RELEASE, or in the case of MouseEvent.Buttons, even InputEvent.Action.SCROLL_FORWARD or InputEvent.Action.SCROLL_BACKWARD.

    There are no guarantees about the order in which KeyEventHandlers and MouseEventHandlers are executed during fire(); any order decision is left to implementations.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addEvent(KeyEvent event)
      Adds a KeyEvent to update the state of the corresponding KeyEvent.Key.
      void addEvent(MouseEvent event)
      Adds a MouseEvent to update the state of the corresponding MouseEvent.Button.
      KeyEventHandler attach(KeyEvent.Key key, KeyEventHandler handler)
      Attaches a KeyEventHandler to a KeyEvent.Key to be executed the next time the appropriate KeyEvent is set when fire() is called.
      MouseEventHandler attach(MouseEvent.Button button, MouseEventHandler handler)
      Attaches a MouseEventHandler to a MouseEvent.Button to be executed the next time the appropriate MouseEvent is set when fire() is called.
      KeyEventHandler detach(KeyEvent.Key key)
      Detaches a KeyEventHandler from the given KeyEvent.Key.
      MouseEventHandler detach(MouseEvent.Button button)
      Detaches an MouseEventHandler from the given MouseEvent.Button.
      void fire()
      Executes all attached EventHandlers whose desired firing state has been satisfied by the most recent InputEvents set through either addEvent(KeyEvent) or addEvent(MouseEvent).
      KeyEvent getKey()
      Gets the most recent KeyEvent.
      MouseEvent getMouse()
      Gets the most recent MouseEvent.
      void setMode(KeyEvent.Key key, boolean fireOnPress, boolean repeatable)
      Sets a KeyEvent.Key to fire on InputEvent.Action.PRESS or InputEvent.Action.RELEASE and whether PRESS events for the Key should generate subsequent InputEvent.Action.REPEAT events.
      void setMode(MouseEvent.Button button, boolean fireOnPress, boolean repeatable)
      Sets a MouseEvent.Button to fire on InputEvent.Action.PRESS or InputEvent.Action.RELEASE and whether PRESS events for the Button should generate subsequent InputEvent.Action.REPEAT events.

    • Method Detail

      • addEvent

        void addEvent(KeyEvent event)

        Adds a KeyEvent to update the state of the corresponding KeyEvent.Key. A KeyEventHandler attached to the KeyEvent.Key may be executed on the next call to fire(), depending on the Key's fire mode.

        Parameters:
        event - KeyEvent.

      • addEvent

        void addEvent(MouseEvent event)

        Adds a MouseEvent to update the state of the corresponding MouseEvent.Button. A MouseEventHandler attached to the MouseEvent.Button may be executed on the next call to fire(), depending on the Button's fire mode.

        Parameters:
        event - MouseEvent.

      • attach

        KeyEventHandler attach(KeyEvent.Key key,
                       KeyEventHandler handler)

        Attaches a KeyEventHandler to a KeyEvent.Key to be executed the next time the appropriate KeyEvent is set when fire() is called.

        Parameters:
        key - keyboard key.
        handler - KeyEventHandler to fire.
        Returns:
        previously set KeyEventHandler, or null if none was set.

      • attach

        MouseEventHandler attach(MouseEvent.Button button,
                         MouseEventHandler handler)

        Attaches a MouseEventHandler to a MouseEvent.Button to be executed the next time the appropriate MouseEvent is set when fire() is called.

        Parameters:
        button - mouse button.
        handler - MouseEventHandler to fire.
        Returns:
        previously set MouseEventhandler, or null if none was set.

      • detach

        KeyEventHandler detach(KeyEvent.Key key)

        Detaches a KeyEventHandler from the given KeyEvent.Key.

        Parameters:
        key - keyboard key.
        Returns:
        removed KeyEventHandler.

      • detach

        MouseEventHandler detach(MouseEvent.Button button)

        Detaches an MouseEventHandler from the given MouseEvent.Button.

        Parameters:
        button - mouse button.
        Returns:
        removed MouseEventHandler.

      • fire

        void fire()

        Executes all attached EventHandlers whose desired firing state has been satisfied by the most recent InputEvents set through either addEvent(KeyEvent) or addEvent(MouseEvent).

        If a KeyEvent.Key or MouseEvent.Button is set as repeatable, and it's current InputEvent.Action is InputEvent.Action.PRESS, then this method will generate a corresponding InputEvent.Action.REPEAT KeyEvent.

      • getKey

        KeyEvent getKey()

        Gets the most recent KeyEvent.

        Returns:
        KeyEvent.

      • getMouse

        MouseEvent getMouse()

        Gets the most recent MouseEvent.

        Returns:
        MouseEvent.

      • setMode

        void setMode(KeyEvent.Key key,
             boolean fireOnPress,
             boolean repeatable)

        Sets a KeyEvent.Key to fire on InputEvent.Action.PRESS or InputEvent.Action.RELEASE and whether PRESS events for the Key should generate subsequent InputEvent.Action.REPEAT events.

        Parameters:
        key - keyboard key.
        fireOnPress - true to fire KeyEventHandlers on PRESS events, false for RELEASE.
        repeatable - true to generate REPEAT events after a PRESS.

      • setMode

        void setMode(MouseEvent.Button button,
             boolean fireOnPress,
             boolean repeatable)

        Sets a MouseEvent.Button to fire on InputEvent.Action.PRESS or InputEvent.Action.RELEASE and whether PRESS events for the Button should generate subsequent InputEvent.Action.REPEAT events.

        Parameters:
        button - mouse button.
        fireOnPress - true to fire MouseEventHandlers on PRESS events, false for RELEASE.
        repeatable - true to generate REPEAT events after a PRESS.
